data.title: Director, Business Affairs Thunderbird Entertainment at Atomic
data.meta_description: Apply now for Director, Business Affairs Thunderbird Entertainment job at Atomic Cartoons in Vancouver, Canada. ––– Atomic Cartoon's parent company,Thunder...
data.text:
Atomic Cartoon's parent company,Thunderbird Entertainment is searching for an exceptional individual to provide business affairs, legal and strategic support for our Vancouver offices on a day to day television production and distribution matters, as well as strategic and practical support for ongoing corporate expansion both at home and internationally.

____

Thunderbird Entertainment was founded in 2003. With offices in Vancouver, Toronto, Ottawa and Los Angeles, we have more than 1000 creatives on our team. And though we all have our unique skills, techniques, niches and passions, one thing is true for us all: we are artists at our core. We have two companies under Thunderbird Entertainment, Atomic Cartoons and Great Pacific Media. Atomic, founded in 1999, produces award-winning animation and GPM, founded in 2011, creates dynamic, award-winning factual and scripted content.

____

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Help strategize and execute all business affairs matters for development, production, post-production, sales, distribution, and service of all entertainment and business endeavors.

Negotiate and draft talent agreements, producer agreements, rights agreements, co-finance agreements and other agreements in connection with the development and production of all entertainment-based television and digital properties.

Handle above and below the line guild issues.

Create and administer legal processes and best practices.

Create and administer legal processes and best practices for the Company. Work with outside counsel handling production legal, litigation, copyright and trademark, music, and rights and clearance matters.

Handle the negotiation, drafting, and closing of all entertainment-related deals and business relationships; including deals to acquire and develop television or digital properties in all genres including animation, live-action, and hybrid films; co-production deals, distribution deals, output deals, first-look deals, all development and production talent agreements, and all other agreements for the ancillary exploitation of intellectual property.

Perform other day-to-day business affairs-related tasks as needed and requested by other members of the executive team.

Ensure the Company’s compliance with its’ own policies, third party agreements, and applicable laws and regulations.

Structure, negotiate and draft complex deals and agreements involving the development, acquisition, and production of television programs (including scripted series and unscripted/reality series, along with marketing, promotional and sales agreements).

Work closely with the Company's management team on the development, production, negotiation, and drafting of agreements and financing applications involving the development, acquisition, and production of content intended for initial distribution via the Internet.

Act as a liaison between the Company's creative executives and the creative community (i.e., talent agencies, talent managers, entertainment law firms, studios, and production companies).

Advise executive team on strategic and complex business structures, risk matters, legal compliance, labor/guild issues and the use of the Company's intellectual property.

Working with the Company's outside counsel to maintain and update terms agreements, corporate best practices and remain up to speed on applicable financing and regulatory issues as they relate to the Company’s interests.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

Minimum 5 years of business and legal affairs experience at a television broadcaster, independent production company and/or major law firm.

Up to date knowledge of the current business affairs environment and practices in both independent television in North America and internationally.

Knowledgeable in regards to the Canadian Television environment including CMF, Telefilm co-production treaties and broadcaster license agreements.

Well established relationships within the entertainment, business affairs and legal communities.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Superior negotiation and legal drafting skills.

Unyielding attention to detail.

Ability to prioritize and manage time, with exceptional organizational skills and a facility with handling a constant stream of high-priority projects

Ability to build effective working relationships within and outside the Company.

Exceptional interpersonal skills needed to maintain credibility and effective working relationships with high level internal and external contacts.

Ability to independently exercise sound judgment, make sound decisions, and perform under minimal supervision on a daily basis.

Strong initiative to take on tasks and set own priorities and deadlines and put forth the maximum effort.

Ability to excel under pressure in a demanding, fast-paced, results-oriented work environment.
